page.title: 09Mattishall Nonconformists.
page.content: In Mattishall,at different times over the last 330 years,the Anglican and Roman Catholic Churches have vied with Independents (later known as Congregationalists and more recently as the United Reformed Church), Quakers,Primitive Methodists (now united with the Methodist Church) and Evangelicals. The growth of non-conformity brought many religious and secular benefits to the community.All responsibility in the parish churches was in the hands of the vicar appointed from outside,and of a very small oligarchy.But the chapels were close and very democratic fellowships where each member had a direct responsibility for the spiritual and material welfare of the congregation and of each individual.
